summary: Implemented transparency rendering in StructuredAnalysisResultCard (Public sources list + Collaborative basis statement) and extended the structured analysis model with `sources` and `collaborativeBasis`. Added i18n labels for transparency sections (file content truncated, but diff summary indicates keys exist). However, the diff does not provide evidence that all analyzers always return at least 2 valid https sources and a truthful collaborative-basis statement for every analysis output, nor that all new engine-generated user-facing strings are fully localized across all supported languages.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure every analyzer output (message/email/phone/crypto) includes a non-empty (>=2) list of public, legal `https://` sources and a truthful collaborative-basis statement, with all new engine-generated user-facing strings localized for PT/EN/ES/FR/ZH/AR/RU.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff shows the new types and UI rendering, but the analyzer implementations (`analyzeMessage`, `analyzeEmail`, `analyzePhone`, `analyzeCrypto`) and their returned `sources`/`collaborativeBasis` payloads are not visible in the provided truncated diff. Therefore there is no evidence that each analyzer always returns >=2 valid absolute `https://` URLs, nor that the collaborative-basis statement is correctly set per output, nor that all newly added engine strings are localized across all supported languages.

hallucinated_features.description: Added/advertised a "critical-keyword High-risk overrides" mechanism in the antifraud engine.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on transparency payload (sources + collaborative basis) and UI/i18n display. A critical-keyword override system is not requested by REQ-31..34.
evidence: frontend/src/utils/structuredFraudAnalysis.ts (header comment: "Supports full localization with critical-keyword High-risk overrides for all languages")
